Last year gave it to my 14yo cousin to try - he finished it in two sittings over the course of two days.

The game is absolutely gorgeous and still holds up to this day in almost every department (with the deep immersion into a believable world being a cornerstone of the experience).
Countless amount of great, free campaign mods for this game alone are worth the full price of the Orange Box, and the amount of fun one can have with the available community-made content reaches infinity.

A "must have" for every Steam user.

Fun to play after all these years and looks great in 4K

Playing Half-Life 2 for the first time in 2021 and writing a review for it to boot; the iron couldn't be hotter.

This is a great game it's definitely front loaded as the first half is an excellently paced set piece extravaganza and I felt a bit of a lull during the back half of Nova Prospekt and Follow Freeman where the action is so heavy and fast paced and I felt the follower A.I. a bit annoying. I think these games are at their best when they keep changing up the game-play with light puzzle solving or the survival horror type segments which are done perfectly in Ravenholm and show up again in places like the radioactive area in Anticitizen One.

Needless to say that this game sticks the landing a hell of a lot better than Half-Life 1 and while the ending lacks any sort of actual sense of conclusion I guess that's just par for the course in this series, it's 2021 not getting my hopes up for anything but prequels.

Good times all around, stepping up the presence of narrative elements really helps make the whole experience feel more complete in comparison to the first game however it does make it feel more on rails even though comparatively both games are extremely linear. More of a trade-off than an actual complaint but I did quite like that feeling of free exploration and rawness that Half-Life 1 had as opposed to this games feeling of pristine curation of events.
Still one of the best games

Half Life 2; A classic action FPS singleplayer game, quite old school but still the one of the best franchise back in the days till now, if this game looks interesting to you don't even hesitate; can basically run on anything so would definitely recommend
